summary: The 'Protecting Our Local Elections Act' (POLE Act) amends the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to prohibit the use of Federal funds for election administration in states that do not allow local governments to hold elections in odd-numbered years. The bill highlights the benefits of odd-year local elections for voter focus and informed decision-making and emphasizes the importance of local governance. The prohibition of funds would take effect in fiscal year 2027.
